page.title: 06Other places of worship
page.content: The{Community of the Epiphany}is now at Copeland Court, Kenwyn. It moved from Tregolls Road about a year ago. It is an{Anglican Order}dedicated to the Epiphany, having 10 Sisters, including the Reverend Mother. Their ages range from 69-94 years. They have worked in other parishes, even as far away as Japan. Their work here has been in the caring for the elderly and still run the{Rosewin Home.}The Sisters are under life vows of poverty, chastity and obedience. Their habits are black. Regular services are held from early morning to about 8p.m. {Quiet Day Retreats}are once a month. The{Company of the Epiphany}recently inaugurated, is a group of people in everyday walk of life, working along with the Sisters. The Company is an extension of the Community.
